pp2.7:6.3_0: With the ending of the five lower fetters they’re reborn spontaneously. They’re extinguished there, and are not liable to return from that world.
pp2.7:7.1_0: And what kind of person has risen up, crossed over, and gone beyond, a brahmin who stands on the shore?

pp2.7:7.3_0: They’ve realized the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And they live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.
pp2.7:7.4_0: Then they have risen up, crossed over, and gone beyond, and that brahmin stands on the shore.
pp2.7:8.1_0: And what person is freed both ways?

pp2.7:8.3_0: This person is called freed both ways.
